      • getLength

        public Data getLength(java.lang.String UOM)
        Description copied from class: Track
        Returns the length of the track using the unit of measure the distance of this track is normally reported in. This is defined in the JSON file. If not defined in the JSON file, then it will default to "mile" in the United States and "km" everywhere else. You can also pass in a UOM as an optional argument.

        PATH = /Track/Length/(UOM)

        Overrides:
        getLength in class Track
        Parameters:
        UOM - (Optional), The UOM to return the track length in. Default to track's UOM, which is based on the country it's in.
        Returns:
        The length of the track in a Data container.

      • getName

        public Data getName()
        Description copied from class: Track
        Returns the name of the track as reported by the SIM. This should include a specific configuration. Clients should make no assumptions about the format of this name. Use it to display only.

        For example: atlanta_qualoval

        PATH = /Track/Name

        Overrides:
        getName in class Track
        Returns:
        The name of the track in a Data container.

        Returns:
        The Pit Speed Limit

      • getSectors

        public Data getSectors(java.lang.String sectorType,
                       java.lang.String UOM)
        Description copied from class: Track
        Returns an array of sector starting and ending points. If SectorType is PERCENTAGE, then with the index starting at zero, the even numbered indexes are the starting points and are inclusive. The odd numbered indexes are the ending points and are exclusive. The number of sectors can be derived by dividing the number of array entries by 2. If SectorType is COORDINATES, then with the index starting at zero, indexes are as follows, (0=startingLat, 1=startingLon, 2=endingLat, 3=endingLon). This pattern repeats throughout the array. The number of sectors can be derived by dividing the number of array entries by 4. If there are no sectors defined, an empty array is returned with a length of zero.

        PATH = /Track/Sectors/(SECTORTYPE)/(UOM)

        Overrides:
        getSectors in class Track
        Parameters:
        sectorType - (optional) Indicates the type of the values being returned. Valid values are Track.SectorType, PERCENTAGE, COORDINATES. Defaults PERCENTAGE.
        UOM - (optional) Specifies the unit of measure to return. %, RAD, DEG. Default is % and DEG.
        Returns:
        An array of sectors in a Data container.

      • getTemp

        public Data getTemp(java.lang.String UOM)
        Description copied from class: Track
        Returns the current temperature of the track. The location of this temperature is SIM specific. Should not be used to understand where grip is best on the track. In most cases you will only want to display it.

        PATH = /Track/Temp/(UOM)

        Overrides:
        getTemp in class Track
        Parameters:
        UOM - (Optional) The unit of measure to convert the temperature in, default to track's UOM.
        Returns:
        The temperature in a Data container.

      • getWeatherWindDirection

        public Data getWeatherWindDirection(java.lang.String UOM)
        Description copied from class: Track
        Returns the wind direction, where East is zero degrees at 3 o'clock. If the UOM is "TEXT", then returns one of the following: N, NE, W, SW, S, SE, E, NE.

        PATH = /Track/WeatherWindDirection/(UOM)

        Overrides:
        getWeatherWindDirection in class Track
        Parameters:
        UOM - (Optional) The unit of measure to return the wind direction in, defaults to "deg".
        Returns:
        The wind direction in a Data container.
